page.title: 05A family's day,Ravensthorpe
page.content: 7 o'clock and the sound of the milkman and his delivery van wakes us up as he leaves two pint bottles on the doorstep Time to get up and washed,dressed and have breakfast of cereals and toast.I switch on the electric kettle to brew a pot of tea.The daily newspaper and the morning post are delivered,the gas and electricity bills. At 8am my husband leaves in his car for his office in Northampton.The boys get their school books ready.Some children are heading for the bus stop to wait for the school bus to Guilsborough.We set off in my car to take Paul and Philip to Guils- borough Primary school.I return home, vacuum the carpets,wash up the dishes and put the laundry into the automatic washing machine.At 11am I walk down the road to change our books borrowed from the mobile library on its weekly visit.
